Hummingbird.name: Hummingbird
Hummingbird.description:
No frills, just raw processing power.

2 slots only for Hardware

+1 to NET Actions each turn.

Kaliya.name: Kaliya
Kaliya.description:
A fantastic option for dismantling hostile Netrunners. Just hope they don’t have any Black ICE.

6 slots for Programs or Hardware, 3 extra slots only for Flak programs.

Restrictions for Defender Programs and Black ICE: Only Flak and Asp can be installed in any slot.

Kerberos.name: Kerberos
Kerberos.description:
Unleash the fires of Hell upon your rivals.

6 slots for Programs, 5 slots for Hardware.

Program slots will only accept Hellhound Black ICE.

Kestrel 2.name: Kestrel 2
Kestrel 2.description:
Black ICE can’t hit what they can’t catch.

7 slots only for Programs.

Right after Jacking In, Netrunner can activate a maximum of 2 installed Speedy Gonzalvez Programs without a NET Action.

Kirama Advanced Deck.name: Kirama Advanced Deck
Kirama Advanced Deck.description:
Though it may not be the flashiest choice, Kirama’s finest Cyberdeck is expertly balanced and offers some highly practical safety features.

5 slots for Programs or Hardware.

Netrunner suffers no negative effects from an Unsafe Jack Out.

Kirama Entry Deck.name: Kirama Entry Deck
Kirama Entry Deck.description:
An affordable and balanced Cyberdeck for novice Netrunners. Though limited by its modest hardware specs, it retains the advanced safety features of Kirama’s flagship Cyberdecks.

5 slots only for Programs.

Only one of each Program category can be installed at a time (Attacker, Defender, Booster, Black ICE). Netrunner suffers no negative effects from an Unsafe Jack Out.

Kirama Training Deck.name: Kirama Training Deck
Kirama Training Deck.description:
The quintessential starter Cyberdeck. Bargain-bin price with bare-minimum hardware specs.

5 slots only for Programs.

Netrunner must be 2m/yds or closer to Access Point to Jack In. All brain damage from NET combat is doubled.

MicroMate.name: MicroMate
MicroMate.description:
Perfect for Netrunners who only know one speed: All offense, all the time. Just don't get hit, it's going to hurt. A lot.

9 slots for Programs or Hardware.

Slots will not accept Defender Programs. All brain damage from NET combat is doubled.

Microtech Assault.name: Microtech Assault
Microtech Assault.description:
Relax and let your Black ICE do all the heavy lifting.

4 slots for Programs, 5 slots for Hardware.

Program slots only accept Black ICE.

Microtech Scout.name: Microtech Scout
Microtech Scout.description:
5 slots for Programs or Hardware.

Netrunner can roll Pathfinder without a NET Action right after Jacking In.

Microtech Warrior.name: Microtech Warrior
Microtech Warrior.description:
7 Slots only for Programs.

Netrunner can activate one Armor Program without a NET Action right after Jacking In.

Parraline 6000.name: Parraline 6000
Parraline 6000.description:
All the Hardware options with none of the restrictions.

3 Program slots, 6 Hardware slots.

Phoenix.name: Phoenix
Phoenix.description:
Never lose a Program again.

6 slots for Programs or Hardware.

Any Program destroyed in a netrunning session is restored upon a safe Jack Out.

Verdant Knight.name: Verdant Knight
Verdant Knight.description:
The classic sword-and-board Cyberdeck build is highly effective against Black ICE. Just don’t plan on going toe-to-toe with a hostile Netrunner.

9 slots only for Programs.

Slots only accept Sword or Shield Programs.

Warlock's Book.name: Warlock's Book
Warlock's Book.description:
A fantastic option for dismantling hostile Netrunners. Just hope they don’t have any Black ICE.

6 slots for Programs or Hardware, 3 extra slots only for Flak programs.

Restrictions for Defender Programs and Black ICE: Only Flak and Asp can be installed in any slot.

Aerie.name: Aerie
Aerie.description: Each installed Raven Black ICE destroys Programs instead of derezzing.

Bushido Accelerator.name: Bushido Accelerator
Bushido Accelerator.description: +3 Speed to all installed Killer Black ICE.

Combat Recorder.name: Combat Recorder
Combat Recorder.description:
Real-world Combat data is invaluable for Black ICE development.

If another Netrunner in the same NET Architecture fails a Death Save, the last 5 minutes of non-self incriminating Netrun combat data is saved to the Cyberdeck. Recordings can be sold for 50eb.

Defense Sequencer.name: Defense Sequencer
Defense Sequencer.description: If an active Armor Program is derezzed or destroyed, Defense Sequencer activates a yet-unused copy of Armor Program at the start of the Netrunner’s turn.

Feline Instinct.name: Feline Instinct
Feline Instinct.description: If an installed Sabertooth Black ICE destroys a program, that Sabertooth deals an extra 1d6 of damage on each subsequent attack for the duration of the Netrun.

Hangry Hangry Dragon.name: Hangry Hangry Dragon
Hangry Hangry Dragon.description: Everytime an installed Dragon Black ICE destroys a Program it regains full REZ.

Perfume Shoppe.name: Perfume Shoppe
Perfume Shoppe.description: Skunk Black ICE will only take 1 option slot to install.

Smithy.name: Smithy
Smithy.description:
Be prepared for anything. Enter a NET Architecture full of Black ICE and you don’t have have a Sword Program handy? Swap out your useless Banhammer with the press of a button.

Use Meat Action to change any and all installed Sword Programs into Banhammer Programs or vice versa.

Snaketrap.name: Snaketrap
Snaketrap.description: Protects against the first attack (Asp, Raven, or Poison Flatline effects) that would destroy a random installed Program. This protective effect can be use only once per Netrun even if multiple copies of Snaketrap are installed.

Swamp Mist.name: Swamp Mist
Swamp Mist.description:
Wisp Black ICE deal 2d6 damage instead of 1d6.

Black ICE Program restrictions: Only Wisps can be installed.

Swifty Clean.name: Swifty Clean
Swifty Clean.description: Netrunner can roll Cloak twice in a single NET Action and take the higher roll. Cloak can only be used once per Netrun when Swifty Clean is installed.
